keywords: convenience@serve with salad for complete meal
subtitle: The salmon is placed on top of diced potato, salad onions, creme fraiche and dill - and wrapped in parchment paper before baking in the oven. The parcels can be unwrapped at the table!

method.text: Par-boil the potatoes in lightly salted water. Allow to cool slightly. Dice and place in a bowl with the salad onions, dill, creme fraiche and toss to coat.
Brush 2 large circles of greaseproof paper with the melted butter. Spoon the warm potato salad evenly between them, on one half of the paper only.
Arrange the salmon pieces on top. Moisten each with a spoonful of stock and season well.

Fold over the paper to encase the filling, to make a semi-circular parcel. Fold the two edges together to seal. Place the parcels on a baking sheet and cook in the oven for 8-10 min until the salmon is cooked and hot. Serve on warmed serving plates and open the parcels up at the table.

title: Salmon fillet with hot potato salad
